conclusion: Convert the temperature at state A from Celsius to Kelvin.
Temperature at state A is 200 K.
Read the pressure and volume at state A from the p-V diagram: p_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
Apply the ideal gas law at state A to relate pressure, volume, number of moles, and temperature: nR = 1.5.
Use standard conditions to determine the ideal gas constant R.
Calculate R using standard conditions: R ≈ 8.31446 J/mol·K.
Calculate the number of moles n using nR and R: n ≈ 0.180401 mol.
Calculate the number of molecules N using n and Avogadro's number: N ≈ 1.082406 x 10^23.
Round the result to two significant digits: N ≈ 1.1 x 10^23.
Alternatively, assume 1 atm = 10^5 Pa and 273 K, with molar volume 22.4 L for 1 mole.
Calculate R using alternative assumptions: R ≈ 8.205128 J/mol·K.
Calculate n using alternative R: n ≈ 0.1828125.
Calculate N using alternative n: N ≈ 1.096875 x 10^23.
Round alternative result to two significant digits: N ≈ 1.1 x 10^23.
Both approaches give the same answer when rounded to two significant digits.
